section.title: Description
section.p: A Practice is an Organizational Provider composed of one or more Provider for the purpose of providing medical services. When the Practice is composed of multiple Providers, it is often called a Group Practice. This class represents information about the association between an Individual Provider and a Practice.

Note that the FHIM makes a simplifying assumption that all Providers are associated with at least one Organizational Providers. Even when a physician is self-employed, we assume that the physician is incorporated, or has some kind of organizational face.

stentry.p: Pointer to the Service Delivery Locations with which the Individual Provider is associated due to his/her affiliation to the Practice.
